p: This is the first phytochemical study on the EO obtained from L. heteromorpha, and on the metabolic composition of the ethyl acetate extracts from L. radula and L. paniculata. The EO of L. heteromorpha was qualitatively and quantitatively characterized and mainly consisted of 27 compounds (including two undetermined), most of them being sesquiterpenoids (63.9%). A major sesquiterpene alcohol, (−)-ledol (21.2%), and a minor sesquiterpene epoxide, (−)-caryophyllene oxide (1.0%), were isolated and their structures confirmed by NMR spectroscopy. Other major components were viridiflorene (27.3%), ( E,E)-α-farnesene (1.4%), ledol (21.2%), spirolepechinene and ( E)-β-caryophyllene (7.1% each), allo-aromadendrene (6.1%), camphor (1.7%), limonene (1.3 %) and β-phellandrene (4.6%).
